title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 11.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11:3, which characteristic must a beast have for the children of Israel to eat it?
options: Parteth the hoof and cheweth the cud
questions.correctAnswer: Parteth the hoof and cheweth the cud
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:3 states that any beast that parteth the hoof, is clovenfooted, and cheweth the cud shall be eaten.

questions.question: Which animal is mentioned in Leviticus 11:4 as chewing the cud but not dividing the hoof, making it unclean?
questions.correctAnswer: Camel
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:4 specifies the camel as chewing the cud but not dividing the hoof, thus it is unclean.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 11:7, the swine is clean because it has a divided hoof and is clovenfooted.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:7 states that although the swine has a divided hoof and is clovenfooted, it does not chew the cud and is therefore unclean.

questions.question: Which of the following may be eaten according to Leviticus 11:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Fish with fins and scales
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:9 commands to eat whatsoever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas and rivers.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11:10, what are creatures in the water without fins and scales considered?
questions.correctAnswer: An abomination
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:10 declares that all creatures in the waters without fins and scales are an abomination and not to be eaten.

questions.question: Which bird is NOT listed among the abominable fowls in Leviticus 11:13-19?
questions.correctAnswer: Dove
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:13-19 lists several birds as abominable including the owl, eagle, and vulture, but does not include the dove.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 11:20, all fowls that creep upon all four are an abomination.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:20 states that all fowls that creep, going upon all four, shall be an abomination.

questions.question: Which flying creeping things that go upon all four may be eaten according to Leviticus 11:21-22?
questions.correctAnswer: Locust, bald locust, beetle, grasshopper
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:21-22 allows eating certain flying creeping things that go upon all four legs and have legs above their feet to leap, specifically locusts and related kinds.

questions.question: What must a person do if they touch the carcass of an unclean animal according to Leviticus 11:24?
questions.correctAnswer: Be unclean until the evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:24 explains that touching the carcass of unclean animals causes uncleanness until the evening.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Leviticus 11:45: 'Ye shall therefore be ______, for I am holy.'
questions.correctAnswer: holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:45 commands holiness, stating 'Ye shall therefore be holy; for I am holy.'

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11:29-30, which of these creeping things is considered unclean?
questions.correctAnswer: Weasel
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:29 lists the weasel among the creeping things that are unclean, unlike locusts and grasshoppers which may be eaten.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 11:33 instructs to break every earthen vessel into which any unclean creature falls.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:33 states that any earthen vessel into which any unclean creature falls must be broken.

questions.question: What is the status of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth according to Leviticus 11:41?
options: An abomination and not to be eaten
questions.correctAnswer: An abomination and not to be eaten
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:41 declares that every creeping thing upon the earth is an abomination and shall not be eaten.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11:46-47, what is the purpose of these laws about clean and unclean creatures?
options: To make a difference between the unclean and the clean
questions.correctAnswer: To make a difference between the unclean and the clean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:47 explains that these laws serve to distinguish clean from unclean creatures and what may be eaten.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Leviticus 11:2: 'These are the beasts which ye shall ______ among all the beasts that are on the earth.'
questions.correctAnswer: eat
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:2 instructs the children of Israel about the beasts which they shall eat.

questions.question: What must be done to clothes after carrying the carcass of an unclean animal, according to Leviticus 11:25?
options: Wash the clothes and be unclean until the evening
questions.correctAnswer: Wash the clothes and be unclean until the evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:25 instructs that anyone bearing the carcass of unclean animals must wash their clothes and remain unclean until evening.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is unsure about which animals to eat for maintaining holiness. Based on Leviticus 11, what principle should you share about eating beasts?
options: Eat only those that part the hoof, are clovenfooted, and chew the cud
Eat any animal that lives on land
Eat only animals that are carnivorous
Avoid all beasts regardless of their characteristics
questions.correctAnswer: Eat only those that part the hoof, are clovenfooted, and chew the cud
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:3 teaches that only beasts which part the hoof, are clovenfooted, and chew the cud are clean and may be eaten. This principle guides believers to obey God's holiness standards by discerning clean from unclean animals. Supporting verses include Leviticus 11:1-3, 46-47.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 11 teach us about faithfulness and obedience in daily living through dietary laws?
options: By following God's commands exactly, even in difficult details like food laws
By choosing foods based on personal preference
By ignoring dietary restrictions since they are outdated
By eating whatever is available without concern
questions.correctAnswer: By following God's commands exactly, even in difficult details like food laws
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11 shows the importance of faithfulness and obedience to God’s Word, even in practical matters like diet (Leviticus 11:1-2, 44-45). This reflects spiritual discipline and trust in God's holiness requirements (Leviticus 11:44).

questions.question: A family is teaching their children about holiness. According to Leviticus 11, what animals should they avoid eating to maintain purity?
options: Animals that chew the cud but do not divide the hoof, like the camel and hare
Animals that have fins and scales
Animals that are fish with scales
Animals that are clovenfooted and chew the cud
questions.correctAnswer: Animals that chew the cud but do not divide the hoof, like the camel and hare
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:4-6 specify that animals like the camel, coney, and hare chew the cud but do not divide the hoof and are therefore unclean. Teaching children these distinctions helps them understand God’s call to holiness and obedience (Leviticus 11:44-45).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 11 encourage integrity and honesty in the workplace concerning food handling?
options: By requiring cleanliness when handling carcasses of unclean animals
By allowing mixing of clean and unclean meat
By ignoring food laws for convenience
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring cleanliness when handling carcasses of unclean animals
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:24-25 instruct that touching or carrying carcasses of unclean animals causes uncleanness until evening and requires washing clothes, emphasizing honesty and integrity in handling food and cleanliness (Leviticus 11:24-25, 32-35).

questions.question: If a believer is struggling with being holy in daily habits, what does Leviticus 11 teach about sanctification?
options: Believers must sanctify themselves and be holy because God is holy
Holiness is optional and only for priests
Holiness comes from external actions only
God does not require holiness from believers
questions.correctAnswer: Believers must sanctify themselves and be holy because God is holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:44-45 calls believers to sanctify themselves and be holy as God is holy. This teaches the importance of spiritual discipline and personal devotion in reflecting God's character in daily life.

questions.question: How can Leviticus 11 guide believers in sharing the Gospel about God's holiness?
options: By explaining how God distinguishes clean from unclean, showing His holiness and justice
By emphasizing only the love of God without mention of holiness
By focusing on cultural food preferences
By ignoring God's laws about cleanliness
questions.correctAnswer: By explaining how God distinguishes clean from unclean, showing His holiness and justice
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:46-47 illustrates God’s purpose to distinguish clean from unclean, revealing His holiness. Sharing this helps others understand God’s justice and call to holiness alongside His mercy.

questions.question: A believer feels tempted to disregard God's commands on clean and unclean animals. What does Leviticus 11 say about the consequences of touching unclean carcasses?
options: They become unclean until the evening and must wash their clothes
They are immediately forgiven without action
questions.correctAnswer: They become unclean until the evening and must wash their clothes
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:24-25 clearly states that touching carcasses of unclean animals causes uncleanness until evening and requires washing clothes, showing God’s standards and the need for obedience and repentance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 11, it is acceptable to eat any fish without fins and scales.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:9-12 teaches that only fish with fins and scales are clean and may be eaten. Fish without fins and scales are an abomination and must not be eaten.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 11 instructs believers to avoid eating certain birds because they are an abomination.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:13-19 lists specific birds that are an abomination and must not be eaten, emphasizing obedience and holiness in dietary practices.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Leviticus 11 teaches that among flying creeping things that go upon all four, you may eat those which have _____ above their feet, to leap upon the earth.
questions.correctAnswer: legs
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:21-22 explains that flying creeping things with legs above their feet to leap on earth, such as locusts and grasshoppers, are clean and may be eaten, highlighting God’s detailed instructions for holiness.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11, what lesson about perseverance through trials can be learned from obeying God's dietary laws?
options: Obedience to God's commands, even when challenging, strengthens faith and holiness
Dietary laws are optional and do not affect spiritual growth
God only cares about major sins, not dietary obedience
Rules about food are irrelevant to Christian living
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commands, even when challenging, strengthens faith and holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11 requires detailed obedience to God's laws despite difficulty, teaching believers perseverance and trust in God's holiness standards (Leviticus 11:44-45).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 11 emphasize the importance of family teaching in spiritual disciplines?
options: By giving clear commands about clean and unclean animals for all Israel, including families
By focusing only on priests and leaders
By allowing each person to decide individually
By not addressing family practices at all
questions.correctAnswer: By giving clear commands about clean and unclean animals for all Israel, including families
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:2 directs Moses and Aaron to speak to the children of Israel, indicating that these laws are for the entire community, including families, to teach holiness and obedience.

questions.question: What biblical truth about humility and contentment can be drawn from Leviticus 11's food laws?
options: Being content with God’s food provisions and humble in obedience to His commands
Seeking only the most desirable foods regardless of God's rules
Rejecting God's commands because they limit freedom
Pridefully choosing foods to impress others
questions.correctAnswer: Being content with God’s food provisions and humble in obedience to His commands
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11 teaches contentment and humility by instructing believers to accept God's provision of clean foods and obey His dietary laws as an expression of reverence (Leviticus 11:3, 44).

questions.question: A believer wants to serve others by respecting their spiritual convictions about food. How does Leviticus 11 guide us in church fellowship regarding dietary distinctions?
options: Respect and honor the distinctions God made between clean and unclean animals
Ignore dietary laws to avoid offending anyone
Encourage everyone to eat whatever they want
Force others to follow your personal diet
questions.correctAnswer: Respect and honor the distinctions God made between clean and unclean animals
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11 emphasizes God’s distinction between clean and unclean animals, teaching believers to respect these holiness boundaries, which helps maintain unity and reverence in church life (Leviticus 11:46-47).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11, what spiritual discipline is shown through washing clothes after touching unclean carcasses?
options: Repentance and purification until the evening
questions.correctAnswer: Repentance and purification until the evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:25 and 28 teach that touching unclean carcasses causes uncleanness until the evening and requires washing clothes, symbolizing repentance and purification as part of spiritual discipline.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 11.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11:3, what two characteristics must a beast have to be permitted for eating?
options: Parteth the hoof and is clovenfooted
Cheweth the cud and parteth the hoof
Is clovenfooted and cheweth the cud
questions.correctAnswer: Is clovenfooted and cheweth the cud
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:3 specifies that beasts which are clovenfooted and chew the cud are permitted for eating, highlighting a dietary law based on these two traits.

questions.question: Leviticus 11 lists several animals that chew the cud but do not have cloven hooves, rendering them unclean. Which of the following is NOT one of them?
questions.correctAnswer: Deer
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:4-6 names the camel, coney, and hare as animals that chew the cud but do not have divided hooves, thus unclean. The deer has cloven hooves and chews the cud, so it is clean.

questions.question: What is the significance of the swine being unclean despite having cloven hooves, according to Leviticus 11:7?
questions.correctAnswer: It cheweth not the cud
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:7 explains that although the swine has cloven hooves, it does not chew the cud, making it unclean. This distinction emphasizes the combination of both traits for clean beasts.

questions.question: Which aquatic creatures are allowed to be eaten according to Leviticus 11:9?
options: Those that creep on the earth
Those that fly over the water
questions.correctAnswer: Those with fins and scales
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:9 commands that only aquatic animals with fins and scales are permitted for eating, establishing a clear dietary boundary for fish and water creatures.

questions.question: What is the term used in Leviticus 11 to describe animals without fins and scales in the water, and what does it imply?
questions.correctAnswer: Abomination; meaning forbidden and detestable
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:10-12 repeatedly uses 'abomination' for aquatic creatures lacking fins and scales, indicating they are detestable and forbidden to the Israelites under the holiness code.

questions.question: Leviticus 11:13-19 lists various birds considered abominable. Which of the following birds is included in that list?
questions.correctAnswer: Eagle
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:13 explicitly names the eagle among the birds considered abominations, forbidding their consumption due to their scavenging and predatory nature.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11:21-22, which type of flying creeping things are allowed to be eaten?
options: Those that have legs above their feet to leap on the earth
Those that crawl on their belly
questions.correctAnswer: Those that have legs above their feet to leap on the earth
questions.explanation: The chapter permits only flying creeping things that have legs above their feet to leap on the earth, such as locusts and grasshoppers, as specified in verses 21-22.

questions.question: True or False: Touching the carcass of an unclean animal makes a person ceremonially unclean until evening, as stated in Leviticus 11.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:24-25 clearly states that touching the carcass of unclean animals results in ceremonial uncleanness until evening, requiring ritual purification.

questions.question: Which animals are specifically mentioned in Leviticus 11:29-30 as unclean creeping things that cause uncleanness upon touch?
options: Weasel, mouse, tortoise, ferret, chameleon, lizard, snail, mole
questions.correctAnswer: Weasel, mouse, tortoise, ferret, chameleon, lizard, snail, mole
questions.explanation: Verses 29-30 list these specific creeping animals as unclean, emphasizing the purity laws against contact with them.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 11:43-45 emphasize about the reason for these dietary and purity laws?
options: To sanctify the people because God is holy
To distinguish Israel from surrounding nations culturally
questions.correctAnswer: To sanctify the people because God is holy
questions.explanation: These verses affirm that the dietary laws are rooted in holiness and sanctification because God is holy, calling Israel to reflect His holiness in their conduct.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Leviticus 11:47 states the purpose of these laws is to make a difference between the ________ and the ________.
questions.correctAnswer: unclean; clean
questions.explanation: Verse 47 explicitly states the laws are to differentiate between the unclean and the clean, guiding Israel's practices accordingly.

questions.question: How does the dietary restriction of not eating animals that do not chew the cud but have divided hooves relate to the broader theme of holiness in Leviticus?
options: It symbolizes separation from pagan nations through obedience
It is a health regulation without spiritual significance
It reflects economic restrictions on meat consumption
It is a temporary rule that was later abolished
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes separation from pagan nations through obedience
questions.explanation: This dietary law highlights Israel's call to holiness by setting them apart from pagan practices, emphasizing obedience and sanctification in daily life (Leviticus 11:7, 11:44).

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Leviticus 11 to organize the lists of clean and unclean animals?
options: Parallelism, contrasting clean and unclean categories
Chiasm, with mirrored categories of animals
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism, contrasting clean and unclean categories
questions.explanation: The chapter uses parallelism by listing characteristics of clean animals followed by contrasting unclean ones to clearly distinguish categories, a common Hebrew literary technique.

questions.question: Which New Testament passage echoes the dietary distinctions found in Leviticus 11 by declaring all foods clean, indicating a shift in covenant understanding?
options: Acts 10:9-16, Peter's vision of unclean animals
Mark 7:19, Jesus declaring all foods clean
questions.correctAnswer: All of the above
questions.explanation: These passages collectively reflect the New Testament's reinterpretation of Old Testament dietary laws, showing a theological development beyond Leviticus 11.

questions.question: In the historical and cultural context of the ancient Near East, why might the dietary laws in Leviticus 11 have been significant for Israel?
options: To maintain ritual purity and identity distinct from neighboring peoples
To ensure economic prosperity through livestock management
To align with Egyptian dietary customs
questions.correctAnswer: To maintain ritual purity and identity distinct from neighboring peoples
questions.explanation: The laws helped Israel maintain a distinct identity and holiness by avoiding animals associated with pagan religions and unclean practices common in the region.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11, which characteristic defines a beast that the Israelites are permitted to eat?
options: Parteth the hoof, is clovenfooted, and cheweth the cud
Is carnivorous and has sharp teeth
questions.correctAnswer: Parteth the hoof, is clovenfooted, and cheweth the cud
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:3 states that animals which part the hoof, are clovenfooted, and chew the cud are clean and may be eaten. This is consistent with other scriptures emphasizing holiness and clean food (Deuteronomy 14:6; Hebrews 13:11; Acts 10:15; Mark 7:19).

questions.question: Which of the following animals does Leviticus 11 specifically declare as unclean because it chews the cud but does not divide the hoof?
questions.correctAnswer: Camel
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:4 states that the camel chews the cud but does not divide the hoof, making it unclean. This distinction reveals God's detailed holiness laws (Isaiah 66:3; Hebrews 9:13; Romans 14:14; 1 Timothy 4:4).

questions.question: What is the requirement for fish to be considered clean and edible according to Leviticus 11?
options: They must have fins and scales
They must be large and swim in fresh water
They must be caught with a net
questions.correctAnswer: They must have fins and scales
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:9 specifies that only creatures in the waters with fins and scales are clean and may be eaten. This principle aligns with God's call for holiness and distinction (Deuteronomy 14:9; Ezekiel 47:9; Matthew 4:19; Revelation 19:17).

questions.question: Leviticus 11 lists several birds considered abominable and not to be eaten. Which of these birds is included in that list?
questions.correctAnswer: Owl
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:16 mentions the owl among unclean birds. This reflects God's holiness standards and the importance of separating clean from unclean (Deuteronomy 14:15; Psalm 102:6; Isaiah 34:11; Matthew 12:43).

questions.question: Which creeping flying insects does Leviticus 11 allow the Israelites to eat?
options: Locust, bald locust, beetle, and grasshopper
questions.correctAnswer: Locust, bald locust, beetle, and grasshopper
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:22 permits eating these specific flying creeping things that have legs above their feet to leap. This shows God’s provision and detailed care in dietary laws (Deuteronomy 14:19; Proverbs 30:27; Matthew 3:4; John 21:9).

questions.question: What is the status of the carcasses of unclean animals according to Leviticus 11?
options: They make a person unclean until evening if touched
They can be eaten if cooked properly
They are considered holy and must be buried
They have no effect on ritual purity
questions.correctAnswer: They make a person unclean until evening if touched
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:24 teaches that touching the carcasses of unclean animals causes ritual uncleanness until evening. This underscores the holiness required in God's people (Numbers 19:11; Ezra 6:21; Mark 7:18-19; Hebrews 9:13).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11, what must one do after bearing the carcass of an unclean animal?
options: Wash their clothes and be unclean until the evening
questions.correctAnswer: Wash their clothes and be unclean until the evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:25 instructs that bearing the carcass of unclean animals requires washing clothes and remaining unclean until evening, symbolizing the need for purification after contact with sin or uncleanness (Leviticus 15:5; Numbers 19:19; Ezekiel 36:25; Hebrews 10:22).

questions.question: Which beasts are declared unclean because they have paws and go on all fours, according to Leviticus 11?
options: Those that go upon their paws among all manner of beasts
questions.correctAnswer: Those that go upon their paws among all manner of beasts
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:27 states that beasts that go upon their paws among all four-footed beasts are unclean, emphasizing God’s distinction between clean and unclean for His holy people (Deuteronomy 14:7; Job 39:1; Psalm 104:18; Romans 14:14).

questions.question: Which creeping things are specifically named as unclean in Leviticus 11?
options: Weasel, mouse, tortoise, ferret, chameleon, lizard, snail, mole
questions.correctAnswer: Weasel, mouse, tortoise, ferret, chameleon, lizard, snail, mole
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:29-30 lists these creeping things as unclean, highlighting God’s call to holiness through separation from impurity (Isaiah 66:17; Ezekiel 47:10; Revelation 18:2; Matthew 23:27).

questions.question: What must be done to an earthen vessel if any unclean creeping thing falls into it, according to Leviticus 11?
options: It must be washed with water
It must be set aside for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: It must be broken
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:33 commands breaking an earthen vessel contaminated by an unclean creature, symbolizing the seriousness of defilement and the need for thorough purification (Exodus 32:19; 2 Kings 4:38-41; Jeremiah 19:11; Hebrews 10:29).

questions.question: What is the principle behind the dietary laws in Leviticus 11, according to verse 47?
options: To distinguish between clean and unclean animals
To promote health and hygiene only
To demonstrate cultural identity separate from neighbors
questions.correctAnswer: To distinguish between clean and unclean animals
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:47 explains the law's purpose is to make a difference between clean and unclean, reflecting God's holiness and the call for His people to be holy (Deuteronomy 14:3; 1 Peter 1:15-16; Hebrews 12:14; Revelation 15:4).

questions.question: Why does Leviticus 11 command the Israelites to sanctify themselves and be holy, as stated in verse 44?
options: Because God is holy and calls His people to reflect His holiness
To gain favor with neighboring nations
questions.correctAnswer: Because God is holy and calls His people to reflect His holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:44 commands holiness because God is holy, emphasizing imitatio Dei (imitating God), a foundational theological principle (1 Peter 1:16; Isaiah 6:3; Hebrews 12:10; Matthew 5:48).

questions.question: What theological truth is emphasized by God reminding the Israelites in Leviticus 11:45 that He brought them out of Egypt to be their God?
options: God’s deliverance establishes the basis for holiness and covenant relationship
God’s power is limited to physical liberation
God only cares about dietary laws
God’s presence is tied to land ownership alone
questions.correctAnswer: God’s deliverance establishes the basis for holiness and covenant relationship
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:45 ties Israel’s holiness to God’s redemptive act in Egypt, showing salvation is foundational for covenant obedience (Exodus 19:5-6; Deuteronomy 7:6; Hosea 11:1; 2 Corinthians 6:17).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the biblical purpose of the distinctions between clean and unclean animals in Leviticus 11?
options: To teach the Israelites about God's holiness and the need for separation from sin
To impose arbitrary rules without spiritual meaning
To restrict food for economic reasons
To create social divisions among tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To teach the Israelites about God's holiness and the need for separation from sin
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11 teaches the distinction of clean and unclean animals to instruct God's people about holiness and separation from sin (Leviticus 20:26; Isaiah 35:8; 1 Corinthians 10:25-27; 2 Corinthians 6:14-17).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 11, what is the consequence of eating the carcass of a clean beast that dies naturally?
options: The eater must wash their clothes and be unclean until evening
The eater must offer a sin offering
questions.correctAnswer: The eater must wash their clothes and be unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11:40 states that eating the carcass of a clean beast that died of itself causes uncleanness until evening, emphasizing God’s concern for purity even in clean animals (Numbers 19:11; Ezekiel 44:25; Hebrews 9:13; John 13:10).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of God’s detailed dietary laws in Leviticus 11 for His people?
options: They symbolize God’s holiness and call His people to live set-apart lives
They are purely health regulations with no spiritual meaning
They were intended only for economic control
They are outdated and no longer relevant
questions.correctAnswer: They symbolize God’s holiness and call His people to live set-apart lives
questions.explanation: Leviticus 11’s laws represent God’s holiness and the call for His people to be holy, separated from sin and impurity (Leviticus 19:2; 1 Peter 1:15-16; Romans 12:1-2; Hebrews 12:14).
